Goodfellas will be next. Believe it or not, there are no good encodes in 1080 under 4gigs. I'll put Hunger Games on the list as well. I'm also considering Inglorious Basterds (YIFY's 1080 was only 1300kbps!) Also, I'm doing a lesser known HBO original movie called Conspiracy (2001) even though there are no HD sources (it will be 576p, but with high bit rate so it can be 'full-screened') - it's an AWESOME movie about high ranking Nazi officers planning the Final Solution. Be sure to check that one out. It's one of my personal favorites. I'm also considering doing Iron Man 1 and 2 even though it's well represented. Iron Man 2 has a director's commentary track that most encoders do not include, and I'll be doing Iron Man 3 in late August as soon as 1080 sources are available.

Slight delay on Goodfellas. I had it completely finished and ready to upload, and then I found another source which had both commentary tracks, so I'm having to re-do it. 

Also, Hunger Games looks pretty well represented now that I look. I know a lot of people aren't big fans of YIFY's audio because they're only 96kbps, but there's another version out there with better bit rates thats about 2.6gigs. I just uploaded Apocalypse Now Redux 1080p and I will be doing Alexander Revisited 1080p (only version of it right now is 17gigs) and by then Goodfellas with both commentary tracks should be done. I'm considering Titanic and Black Swan as well. YIFY's Titanic has an abysmally low bit rate (1532) and his encode of Black Swan had a lot of pixelation and artifacts in the darker scenes.
